project_context: Some expenses this past year have been covered by individual members of the community. Discord, Zoom, Miro all have costs associated.
Conflict resolution is difficult without an agreed upon history documented on blockchain.
University students are the future of blockchain tech but they aren't fully engaged in the Project Catalyst program.
Defining and creating the conditions for meaningful participation across a global community of never ending epochs is timeless.
Vietnamese stakeholders have difficulties to read, understand and evaluate submitted proposals in project Catalyst.
How to show new people Catalyst projects success, experience & benefits of involvement? How to entertain & motivate to make proposals?
Introducing automated tools requires access control for using the tools
It takes time to maintain and moderate a large Discord channel
Newcomers need education to understand the system + recognise scams. Lack of content on real world use cases explaining the vision + basics.
There isn't enough participation + story sharing about SPOs in the Cardano ecosystem, in different languages globally, found in one place.
Finding an expert or monetizing your expertise requires centralized vetting services that limit your choices and control your access.
What are the best practices for adapting the incubator model to support new Catalyst startup?
News & education about Cardano & blockchain should be available in native languages. However, The crypto world is English-speaking oriented
It takes too long+too many resources to understand when&how to contribute and engage in Catalyst.
Documentation of Catalyst-Swarm, a self organizing community supporting the success of Project Catalyst, requires support to be sustainable.
Information about how voters interact with Catalyst is not well understood, and there are few initiatives tackling this at the moment.
The site helps onboard 1000s of users. New features are requested & ideated, upgrades are required. Bounty system needs further development.
Cardano will struggle with adoption by young people without collaboration from established artists and key amplifiers from arts & culture.
Participating in Catalyst is difficult when you live in the eastern time zone and your language is not English.
Education about Catalyst would benefit from a more fluid and tailored experience for new community members to help increase engagement.
Encouraging meaningful participation requires experimenting with different approaches to determine the best way to engage the community.
The majority of ADA holders eligible to vote either have never voted or never heard of Catalyst.
Many Catalyst concepts are is difficult to understand and hard to explain.
New members wish to support catalysts but it is time-consuming and complex to learn how one can engage
Proposers, Advisors, Voters and other Catalyst members still struggle to understand how Catalyst works and how to play their roles.
Current wallet software separates utility and education, creating a barrier for people to enter and to trust the crypto space and Cardano.
Catalyst has hundreds of proposals being submitted and the average person lacks a simple way to understand the mission behind each project.
A lack of incentives for contributing to Catalyst means that those without the leisure time may be forgoing paid work to participate
The Catalyst community needs organized spaces to discuss and brainstorm on current issues and projects
